page.title: 05THE VILLAGE HALLS
page.content: The hall is a focus of village life. The{Doddinghurst Village Hall}is prefabricated and was bought second- hand from Maldon. This year the roof and porches were replaced. {St Margaret's Hall}is run by the Catholic community. Both halls are widely used by village organisations. For young children, playgroup sessions and for older children there are lessons in karate, judo, ballet and tap; and in the summer a playscheme which provides holiday activities. Adults can attend keep-fit, yoga, and dancing. The W.I and the Horticultural Society use the halls for meetings, as do "The Happy Old 'Uns". Troops of Guides and Scouts have their own{Hut. {The Kelvedon Hatch Hall,}(1973) , is licenced and is used for a similar variety of community activities.
